result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Francis Gillard

defendant.name: Gillard, James Francis
defendant.address: 201 Wight St Apt E, Orfordville, WI 53576

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on January 4, 2023 at 10:45 am.

9:30 AM Defendant James Francis Gillard appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for James Francis Gillard.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Douglas Thiering sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

3:03 PM Defendant James Francis Gillard appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for James Francis Gillard.  Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
records.courtRptr: D Nelson / J Klaren / M Lindbloom

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
